definition: to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)

sentences.english: Buy flowers, she is at it again, she happily between two people.
sentences.chinese: 买花失利，周母再出新招，她乐此不疲地撮合两人。

sentences.english: Well aware of the danger of rock-climbing, he still loved and indulged in it as before.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他很清楚攀岩的危险，但他仍乐此不疲。

sentences.english: Trading antique and collector cars keeps him busy.
sentences.chinese: 古董交易和汽车收藏令他乐此不疲。

sentences.english: Though she still enjoyed it, I felt tired and bored.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她乐此不疲，但我甚感厌倦和疲惫。

sentences.english: Most people never get tired of delivering a festival similar to the activities of the sweepstakes .
sentences.chinese: 人们最乐此不疲的一项节日活动类似于摸彩。

sentences.english: You can fish from the zar bank with ease.
sentences.chinese: 你可以从远鱼银行乐此不疲。

sentences.english: One of the most popular events of the day was a game like drawing lottery.
sentences.chinese: 人们最乐此不疲的一项节日活动类似于摸彩。

sentences.english: She masters already adroitly small the method of loan, and be very happy with it.
sentences.chinese: 她已经熟练掌握一套小额贷款的方法，并且乐此不疲。

sentences.english: She's still giving the toughest English history exams in the school and loving every minute of it.
sentences.chinese: 她还是在学校里出最难的英国史考试题，且乐此不疲。

sentences.english: I don't expect you to be nice. 'I am the master of low expectations. '
sentences.chinese: 我把你使小性子当作享受，乐此不疲。

sentences.english: This is the real reason that people are never bored with it.
sentences.chinese: 这就是许多人对饭局乐此不疲的原因。

sentences.english: They are “living off the thrill of peer attention.
sentences.chinese: 他们“因为同龄人的关注而兴奋，乐此不疲。

definition: lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
not to mind taking all the trouble (idiom)/to take great pains/to be very patient
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
